mainHeading: Emotional Intelligence Assistant using a Hybrid Augmented Generation Framework.
context: A research-based multi-turn therapy assistant built using a hybrid generation pipeline that combined Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Cache-Augmented Generation (CAG) to enhance emotional intelligence and memory retention in chatbot conversations.
objectives: Built a chatbot capable of emotionally supportive, therapy-style dialogue
Integrated RAG to retrieve past session summaries using ChromaDB
Injected pre-validated therapeutic knowledge into context using CAG
Compared open-source and API-based models under the same memory framework
Evaluated models using semantic similarity and human-rated empathy scores
features: Hybrid memory pipeline with both RAG and CAG integration
Fine-tuned GPT-4o-mini on a multi-turn mental therapy dataset
Implemented KV caching using LLaMA 3.2 1B Instruct for CAG
Used ChromaDB with a context classifier to enable session recall
Achieved 67.5% semantic similarity and a 4.5/5 expert-rated empathy score
